title: Abound Secures $14M Funding: Revolutionizing Remittance for Indian Expats
body: Are you an Indian expat in the U.S. looking for a seamless way to send money home? The world of remittance apps is buzzing with innovation, and Abound is making waves. This exciting fintech startup has just announced a significant milestone, securing $14 million in its first funding round. Led by the NEAR Foundation, this investment signals a major leap forward for Abound and the future of cross-border payments. Let‚Äôs dive into what this means for you and the evolving landscape of international money transfers. Why is Abound‚Äôs $14M Funding a Big Deal for Indian Expats? Securing $14 million in its initial funding round is no small feat, especially in today‚Äôs dynamic financial climate. This investment, spearheaded by the NEAR Foundation, isn‚Äôt just about numbers; it‚Äôs a strong vote of confidence in Abound‚Äôs vision and its potential to transform how Indian expats in the U.S. manage their finances and connect with home. Here‚Äôs why this funding matters: Expansion of Services: The funding will fuel Abound‚Äôs plans to broaden its service offerings beyond basic money transfers. Think enhanced features, more financial tools, and a wider range of services tailored to the specific needs of the affluent Indian expat community. Technological Advancement: A significant portion of the investment will be channeled into strengthening Abound‚Äôs tech infrastructure. This means a more robust, secure, and user-friendly app experience for you. Expect faster transactions, improved security protocols, and cutting-edge features. Market Growth: Abound isn‚Äôt stopping at the U.S. market. With this funding, the startup is setting its sights on expanding into new territories like Canada and the UAE. This expansion means more accessibility and potentially better services for Indian expats in these regions as well. Abound: More Than Just a Remittance App Launched in 2023 by Times Internet, Abound isn‚Äôt just another remittance app . It‚Äôs designed with a specific demographic in mind: affluent Indian expats in the United States. This targeted approach allows Abound to offer services that go beyond simple money transfers. What makes Abound stand out? Tailored Services: Abound understands the unique financial needs of its target audience. By focusing on affluent Indian expats, they can customize their services to meet specific requirements, offering more relevant and valuable features. Rewards and Cashback: Unlike traditional remittance services, Abound sweetens the deal with rewards and cashback opportunities on everyday essentials. This adds extra value to every transaction, making it more appealing than standard transfer methods. User-Centric Approach: Abound prioritizes user experience. The app is designed to be intuitive and easy to use, ensuring a smooth and hassle-free experience for sending money home. The Role of NEAR Foundation in Funding Cross-Border Payments The NEAR Foundation, a key player in the blockchain space, led Abound‚Äôs funding round. Why is a foundation focused on blockchain investing in a fintech funding round for a remittance app? This highlights the increasing convergence of cryptocurrency and traditional finance. Here‚Äôs what the NEAR Foundation‚Äôs involvement signifies: Innovation in Payments: NEAR Foundation‚Äôs investment indicates a belief in the power of technology to revolutionize the payments industry. They are likely betting on Abound to leverage innovative technologies to enhance cross-border payment solutions. Blockchain and Remittances: While not explicitly stated that Abound is a crypto remittance app, the involvement of a blockchain-centric foundation suggests a potential future integration or utilization of blockchain technology to streamline and secure transactions. This could lead to faster, cheaper, and more transparent cross-border payments . Strategic Alignment: The NEAR Foundation likely sees Abound as a strategic partner in expanding the reach of digital financial services, particularly in emerging markets and for specific communities like Indian expats. Navigating Challenges and Looking Ahead in the Remittance Market While the funding is a significant boost, Abound, like any startup in the competitive remittance app market, will face challenges. What hurdles might they encounter, and what does the future hold? Potential Challenges: Competition: The remittance market is crowded with established players like Western Union, Remitly, and Wise, as well as numerous other fintech startups. Standing out and gaining market share will require continuous innovation and effective marketing. Regulatory Landscape: Navigating the complex and varying regulatory requirements across different countries, especially as they expand to Canada and the UAE, can be challenging. Compliance and legal hurdles need to be carefully managed. Customer Acquisition: Reaching and acquiring affluent Indian expats in the U.S. requires targeted marketing strategies and building trust within this community. Effective customer acquisition will be crucial for growth. Future Opportunities: Expanding Service Portfolio: Beyond remittances, Abound could explore offering more comprehensive financial services to Indian expats, such as investment options, savings accounts, and even credit products tailored to their needs. Strategic Partnerships: Collaborating with banks, financial institutions, and other service providers in both the U.S. and India could enhance Abound‚Äôs reach and service offerings. Technological Innovation: Leveraging emerging technologies like blockchain and AI could further optimize their services, reduce costs, and enhance user experience, giving them a competitive edge in the cross-border payments space. Actionable Insights for Indian Expats For Indian expats in the U.S., Abound‚Äôs funding and expansion are positive news. What should you consider? Explore Abound: If you regularly send money to India, check out the Abound app. See if their services, rewards, and user experience align with your needs. Compare their offerings with your current remittance methods. Stay Informed: Keep an eye on Abound‚Äôs developments, especially their expansion into new markets and the launch of new features. This funding could lead to enhanced services that directly benefit you. Consider Fintech Options: Abound‚Äôs success highlights the growing importance of fintech solutions in cross-border payments . Be open to exploring other fintech apps and platforms that offer specialized services for expats. Conclusion: Abound‚Äôs Bold Step into the Future of Remittances Abound‚Äôs $14 million funding round marks a significant milestone in its journey to revolutionize remittance app services for Indian expats. With the backing of the NEAR Foundation and a clear vision for expansion and innovation, Abound is poised to become a major player in the cross-border payments market. For Indian expats in the U.S., this means more choices, potentially better services, and a future where sending money home is easier, more rewarding, and technologically advanced. Keep watching this space ‚Äì Abound‚Äôs story is just beginning, and it promises to reshape how you connect financially with home. To learn more about the latest fintech and crypto trends, explore our article on key developments shaping fintech innovation and cross-border payments.

title: US DOJ says it seized Hamas crypto meant to finance terrorism
body: The US Justice Department (DOJ) seized more than $200,000 in cryptocurrency intended to benefit the militant group Hamas it said in a statement on March 27. The cryptocurrency with a total value of $201,400 was traced to fundraising addresses allegedly controlled by Hamas and used to launder more than $1.5 million in digital assets since October 2024. The laundering occurred through a series of ‚Äúvirtual currency exchanges and transactions by leveraging suspected financiers and over-the-counter brokers,‚Äù the DOJ said. The funds are currently held in a combination of at least 17 wallets. Affidavit to seize the Hamas-linked cryptocurrency. Source: US DOJ In January 2024, the US Treasury‚Äôs Office of Foreign Assets Control, along with corresponding organizations in the United Kingdom and Australia, announced sanctions against networks and facilitators of crypto transactions linked to Hamas. Those sanctions were built on US Treasury sanctions from October 2023. In January 2024, three families of victims of the Hamas attack against Israel sued Binance and its former CEO Changpeng Zhao , alleging that the exchange had provided ‚Äúsubstantial assistance‚Äù to terrorists. In oral arguments, a lawyer representing Binance claimed the exchange had ‚Äúno special relationship [with] Hamas .‚Äù Binance has faced scrutiny from the US government over alleged shortcomings in its Anti-Money Laundering controls. The exchange settled with the DOJ for $4.3 billion in November 2023. More regulation needed? According to a December 2024 report by the Congressional Research Service, Hamas has allegedly sought cryptocurrency donations since at least 2019, although the ‚Äúscale and effectiveness‚Äù of these efforts have been unclear. Terrorist organizations using crypto for fundraising have increasingly drawn the attention of the US, with some officials questioning whether the industry needed more supervision or regulation to stop such behavior. According to a 2023 Chainalysis report, terrorism financing accounts for a very small amount of crypto usage, with illegal groups sticking to using traditional, fiat-based methods to fund operations. Magazine: Terrorism and the Israel-Gaza war have been weaponized to destroy crypto

title: ZachXBT raises red flags about Token2049 sponsors
body: Earlier today, ZachXBT shared updates about his latest observations via his Telegram group. This time, the spotlight was on Token2049, a prominent cryptocurrency event that is expected to attract major industry players in three separate events later this year. The alert warned members of the group to be wary of sponsors as the event approaches because conveners typically do very little due diligence on these supporters. ‚ÄúJust because someone is a title or platinum sponsor does not mean they are credible,‚Äù Zach wrote. Zach blow s wh istle about shady and sketchy Token2049 sponsors The report listed Spacecoin as the title sponsor of the upcoming event, but according to Zach, it is a ‚Äúbotted project.‚Äù Connect with @_spacecoin , Title Sponsor of #TOKEN2049 Dubai! Spacecoin is the world‚Äôs first DePIN powered by satellites, building trustless, decentralized internet connectivity on a global scale. Learn more: https://t.co/ove4Sodour pic.twitter.com/n6DMQ1rZgm ‚Äî TOKEN2049 (@token2049) March 20, 2025 A quick look at Spacecoin‚Äôs page revea ls i t is aiming to be the world‚Äôs first DePIN project that is powered by satellites. It claims its ‚Äúdecentralized satellite constellation provides global 5G internet access to the 2.9 billion people who remain unconnected‚Äù and has lofty ambitions of connecting the world via its satellites. The term ‚Äúbotted‚Äù can be interpreted in a number of ways in crypto, but none is flattering. On the bright side, its name appears alongside platforms like OKX, BloFin, MEXC, KuCoi n and Binance as ‚Äútitle sponsors. ‚Äù The on-chain sleuth also tagged Bitunix, JuCoin, WEEX, and DWF, which Token2049 lists as platinum sponsors as ‚Äúsketchy. ‚Äù Zach pointed out in his report that the teams he mentioned are the ones on his radar for now. However, he expects the list to grow longer before the first event starts in April. For the centralized exchanges that made the ‚Äúsketchy‚Äù list, Zach said he checked to verify if the team is public and has a prior work history in the space. The listed platform s including Bitunix, JuCoin, & WEE X all failed this test. Bitunix, which Zach described as a ‚Äúsketchy exchange,‚Äù is an actual cryptocurrency exchange registered in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines and it offers spot and futures trading. Some days ago , a report revealed that Bitunix is being targeted by South Korea‚Äôs Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) of the Financial Services Commission (FSC) for providing services to Korean customers without proper registration. The crypto platform reportedly operates Korean-language websites and provides market and customer support activities targeted to Korean investors without notifying authorities or filing for a VASP license. JuCoin, also tagged ‚Äúsketchy‚Äù by Zach, is another exchange, previously known as Jubi. It may have gotten on Zach‚Äôs radar because it has a history of ownership changes, rebrand s and regulatory pivots. Ironically, the exchange announced that it had applied for its VASP license to operate in Taiwan, stating that it ‚Äúis taking the lead in Taiwan‚Äôs compliance process by officially applying for regulatory licenses, implementing KYC systems. ‚Äù Another eyebrow-raiser may be that JuCoin is not regulated in the US, EU, or other major markets with strict regulatory standards, except for an exemption from Singapore‚Äôs Monetary Authority. WEEX, another sketch y company according to Zach , is a crypto futures exchange established in 2018 and registered in Singapore. The doubts about the exchange are because it is not regulated by a financial authority with strict standards. There have also been social media posts complaining of weird behavior on the exchange, such as frozen accounts and unwarranted KYC issues. DWF, tagged as a ‚Äúsketchy market maker,‚Äù is a known Web3 investor and market maker, trading on over 60 exchanges and involved in high-profile investments. It may have been included on Zach‚Äôs list because of past accusations of wash trading as a market maker and the more recent rug allegation from Vite Labs. Vite Labs made the rug allegation hours ago today, March 27, 2025. The allegation was shared on the project‚Äôs X page and claimed that ‚Äúthe funds left for development got rugged by @DWF market making service and @binance delist decision. ‚Äù ‚ÄúWe will only maintain the network until we can no longer support it. All roadmap plans are cancelled,‚Äù the post from Vite Labs concluded . Hi guys we want to update that the funds left for development got rugged by @DWF market making service and @binance delist decision. We will only maintain the network until we can no longer support it. All roadmap plans are cancelled. ‚Äî Vite Labs üèÉüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è (@vitelabs) March 27, 2025 In the comments section of the post, people demanded more information on how DWF Labs may have rugged the fund s, but Vite Labs did not provide any further explanation. As for Binance, it claimed that it delisted Vite Labs‚Äô token because it no longer met certain requirements. The wash trading allegation linked to DWF Labs came in May 2024. It accused the market maker of conducting over $300 million in wash trades across seven tokens in 2023, manipulating the price of Yield Guild Games‚Äô native token , Y GG and other cryptocurrencies. Binance refuted the allegations, claiming that the transactions were proprietary and were free o f manipulati on while accusing the head of the monitoring team of collaboration with DWF‚Äôs competitors, leading to his termination. Binance has affirmed its strict market surveillance program and commitment to combating market abuse. The exchange has said that it does not tolerate manipulation practices and has dismissed nearly 355,000 users with a transaction volume of over $2.5 trillion for violating its terms of use in the past couple of years. The danger of sketchy platforms posing as sponsor s A sketch y character sponsoring an event, brand, or politician happe ns in all spheres of life, including crypto. It does not happen often at the Token204 9 eve nt but a case was recorded not too long ag o whi ch had disastrous consequences . Za ch in hi s repo rt highlighted one incident from late 2023 when a sketchy exchange known as JPEX was chosen as a platinum sponsor for that year‚Äôs Token 2049 conference. The team was flagged by the Hong Kong government during the conference as an unlicensed company with allegedly ‚Äúsuspiciou s features .‚Äù After victims made abou t 14 00 reports to law enforcement, about 70 people were arrested by the police in connection with the HK$1.6 billion JPEX cryptocurrenc y scand al and nearly HK$230 million (US$29.37 million) in assets were immediately frozen. The scandal was tagged Hong Kong‚Äôs biggest case of alleged financial fraud. Despite all the heat, the platform remained defiant, hitting users with an exorbitant fee for virtual asset withdrawals. Police Commissioner Raymond Siu Chak-yee later revea led the number of arrests related to the case had shot up t o 72 and about HK$228 million had been frozen. ‚ÄúThe force has received 2,636 reports with regard to the case as of today, and the amount involved is about HK$1.6 billion,‚Äù he said. Among those previously arrested were social media influencers who had appeared in adverts for the trading platform and set up their own over-the-counter shops. These included Chan Wing-yee, Joseph La m Ch ok and Sheena Leung. We're thrilled to be partnering for TOKEN2049, a key crypto event! Join us for our "Grab the Bitcoin" activity with a total prize pool of up to 100,000 USDT. From Sep 13-14, 2023, at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore. Complete tasks to win a Bitcoin & more! See you at TOKEN2049 #JPEX ‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/QuT3IsPOp4 ‚Äî JPEX_Official (@ExchangeJpex) September 12, 2023 JPEX probably signed on as a sponsor for the event in hopes that it would help boost its credibility, which would attract even more users. Another example of a crypto project that employed this tactic is Centra Tech, a fraudulent crypto project that leveraged celebrity endorsements and event appearances to gain credibility. With its antics, it secured $32 million in funding through an ICO, claiming to offer a debit card for crypto payments. Those behind it went as far as talking about it at events, touting fake partnerships with Visa and Mastercard. The SEC charged them with fraud in 2018, and co-founder Sohrab Sharma was sentenced to eight years in prison. An even more popular example is the FTX saga. FTX, now a bankrupt exchange, used its significant political influence, which it got by sponsoring politicians, to enhance its reputation. Its form er CEO S am Bankman-Fr ied would donate millions to political campaigns in the US, including $1 million to a McConnell-aligned super PAC days before FTX‚Äôs 2022 collapse. The purpose of the spending was to keep FTX on the favorable side of regulation, but in the end, FTX was exposed for misappropriating $10 billion in customer funds, leading to Bankman-Fried‚Äôs conviction in 2023. title: Simplifying Crypto Payments Using TradFi Will Drive Adoption
body: Key Takeaways: Traditional banking methods join digital payment systems. New processes reduce friction and simplify crypto transactions. Enhanced security and clear rules boost user confidence. This approach may widen access in underserved areas. Although Bitcoin (BTC) has long been perceived as a store of value, analysts in 2024 predicted that its next major use case could emerge in the form of payments, driven by shifting regulations and increasing infrastructure support. According to EMARKETER , crypto payment adoption was expected to grow by 82.1% over two years beginning in 2024, supported by friendlier regulations and expanding payment provider networks . Source: EMARKETER A Bitget Wallet report also highlighted security concerns as the biggest barrier to crypto payment adoption. What‚Äôs driving crypto payment adoption and what‚Äôs holding it back? We surveyed 4,599 users to uncover key trends shaping the future of PayFi Here‚Äôs the key findings from our 2025 PayFi Report! pic.twitter.com/yycmW7OcWO ‚Äî Bitget Wallet (@BitgetWallet) March 25, 2025 The report, which surveyed 4,599 users, found that over 37% of respondents considered security risks the main obstacle to using cryptocurrency for payments. Other concerns included irreversible transactions and a lack of legal protection. Source: Bitget Wallet Simplifying Crypto Payments With Traditional Platforms In response to ongoing security and usability issues, some platforms have started to streamline the crypto payment process to encourage broader usage. Bakhrom Saydulloev, a product lead at payments infrastructure firm Mercuryo , told Cryptonews that crypto payments had shown consistent growth despite wider market fluctuations. ‚ÄúThe data supports this outlook, as Mercuryo is observing steady growth in payment volumes across our ecosystem despite broader market fluctuations,‚Äù said Saydulloev. Saydulloev noted that user experience remains a major hurdle. ‚ÄúMany products remain unnecessarily complex, fostering friction at every step from account opening to completing transactions,‚Äù he remarked. ‚ÄúBeyond these issues, users simply want what they expect from any payment system: low costs, speed, and safety.‚Äù Saydulloev noted that Mercuryo had begun integrating traditional payment methods to address these issues. For example, the company partnered with Revolut Pay, a mainstream online payment platform, to make buying and selling crypto more accessible. ‚ÄúRevolut Pay simplifies buying crypto assets to a single click,‚Äù Saydulloev said. ‚ÄúThe platform also has reinforced security features, including biometric technology and passcodes that secure the crypto purchasing process for users.‚Äù Crypto exchange CEX.IO has also adopted traditional methods to simplify crypto transactions. Alexander Kerya, vice president of product management at CEX.IO, said the platform recently integrated with MoneyGram to support cash-in and cash-out services for USDC. ‚ÄúThis integration facilitates crypto cash-in and cash-out services, enabling seamless conversion of Circle‚Äôs USDC stablecoin into physical cash and vice versa,‚Äù Kerya said. Kerya added that he believes the growing collaboration between traditional finance (TradFi) and crypto services is gradually blurring the lines between these two industries. Regulatory Support for Crypto Payment Adoption These platform efforts coincide with evolving regulatory frameworks that support safer adoption. Bitget Wallet‚Äôs report shows that 27% of investors are worried about the lack of legal protection. This signals the need for better safeguards and regulatory clarity around crypto payments. Saydulloev highlighted regulatory progress in the EU and UK. Frameworks such as the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA) now allow credit institutions to issue crypto assets under their existing banking licenses. ‚ÄúRather than hindering innovation, these regulations create essential trust by establishing consistent rules and protections, which are prerequisites for wider adoption,‚Äù Saydulloev commented. Coinbase has also focused on easing friction around crypto payments, particularly stablecoins. A company spokesperson noted that free USDC transfers and fiat onramps make it easier for users to send and receive crypto. Coinbase‚Äôs layer-2 network, Base, also allows near-instant crypto transactions with very low fees. Statistics from CoinGate , a payment platform, show that stablecoins are becoming a preferred method for crypto payments. In 2024, stablecoins accounted for 35.5% of transactions on the platform, with USDT making up 97.2% of those, followed by USDC at 2.5% and DAI at 0.3%. Global Demand for Faster, Accessible Crypto Payments While adoption in developed regions remains gradual, crypto payments are gaining traction in emerging markets with limited banking access. Bitget Wallet‚Äôs data showed that 46% of users prefer crypto payments over fiat due to speed and efficiency. Interest was particularly strong in Africa and Southeast Asia, where 52% and 51% of respondents, respectively, expressed interest in using crypto for payments. Rich Rine, an initial contributor at Core DAO, told Cryptonews that in developing regions, crypto is more than just an alternative‚Äîit‚Äôs often the first access to financial infrastructure. ‚ÄúIn regions with large unbanked or underbanked populations, crypto payments are a 0 to 1 leap in trust and access,‚Äù Rine said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not about replacing a legacy system; it‚Äôs about gaining access to a system in the first place.‚Äù Rine added that for adoption to grow in the US and Europe, payment solutions must compete with existing systems that offer fraud protection and chargebacks. ‚ÄúThis likely requires clearer regulatory frameworks ‚Äì especially around stablecoins ‚Äì and tighter integration between TradFi and decentralized finance (DeFi) ,‚Äù he said. For example, he suggested that banks could offer fraud protection and chargeback services on top of stablecoin rails, helping users benefit from fast infrastructure without sacrificing security. Beyond security and infrastructure, financial incentives may also shape the future of crypto-based transactions. ‚ÄúThis adds complexity, but also introduces the idea that payments themselves could become productive, not just functional,‚Äù he said. Building Trust and Access The drive to simplify crypto payments speaks to a deeper call for secure and inclusive financial services. Traditional banks and digital providers now work side by side to build systems that users can rely on. Their combined focus on safety and usability has the power to expand access for those left behind by older models. This collaboration opens new doors for trust and participation in financial affairs. Think about how this blend of old and new might expand opportunities for you and your community. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) How will combining traditional banking with crypto payments alter consumer use? Integrating established banking methods with digital assets offers a smoother transaction experience. This approach combines secure, familiar processes with quicker crypto transfers, lowering hurdles for daily payments. What benefits can merchants and users expect from a streamlined crypto process? A streamlined process reduces transaction friction for both merchants and consumers. By integrating secure, known banking practices, it provides faster service and ease of use, promoting smoother digital trade. How can regulators and industry leaders work together to build trust in simplified crypto payments? Regulators and industry players must establish clear, consistent rules that merge secure traditional practices with modern digital tools. This cooperative effort fosters trust and promotes broader user confidence. The post Simplifying Crypto Payments Using TradFi Will Drive Adoption appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Yield-Bearing Stablecoins Could Hit 50% Market Share: JPMorgan
body: Stablecoins have always been popular in crypto because they offer stable alternatives to volatile digital assets. However, a new type of digital fund, yield-bearing stablecoins , is gaining traction in the industry. These tokens offer interest to investors, similar to how savings accounts in traditional banks work. JPMorgan analysts, led by managing director Nikolaos Panigirtzoglou, believe yield-bearing stablecoins could grow massively in the coming years. Currently, these stablecoins make up just 6% of the stablecoin market. Panigirtzoglou suggests they could grow to 50% if regulatory hurdles do not slow them down. Why More Investors Are Choosing Yield-Bearing Stablecoins JPMorgan analysts say more people choose yield-bearing stablecoins because they offer interest without risk. Panigirtzoglou explained that investors do not need to trade or lend money; just holding these treasury funds is enough. These stablecoins have grown fast in recent months. Since the U.S. election in November 2024, the top five treasury-backed assets have increased in value. This includes Ethena‚Äôs USDe, Sky Dollar‚Äôs USDS, BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL, Usual Protocol‚Äôs USD0, and Ondo Finance‚Äôs USDY. Their market cap has jumped from $4 billion to over $13 billion. As traditional decentralized finance (DeFi) platform yields have dropped, more investors are turning to them. Crypto trading platforms now accept tokenized U.S. Treasurys as collateral, making earning interest while holding assets easier. Additionally, well-known crypto projects like Frax Finance are now using these stablecoins, which is pushing the trend further. The SEC‚Äôs Approval Could Open the Door for More Growth Despite their fast growth, yield-bearing stablecoins still face challenges. They are classified as securities, which creates legal issues and limits their use, especially for everyday investors. However, things might be changing. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) recently approved a new yield-bearing tokens called YLDS, which is registered as a security. This could open the door for more stablecoins like it. Traditional stables, like Tether‚Äôs USDT and Circle‚Äôs USDC, do not share their earnings with users because doing so would make them securities. That would bring stricter rules, making them harder to use in crypto transactions. More companies might follow this model with the SEC approving a yield-bearing stablecoin. Will Yield-Bearing Stablecoins Replace Traditional Ones? Unlike traditional stablecoins with a $220 billion market cap, these newer assets have lower liquidity and are not widely used. However, JPMorgan analysts believe these obstacles may fade as more traders and projects adopt them. As more traders and crypto projects use yield-bearing tokens, their liquidity could improve. This could make them widely used as collateral in crypto trading, part of DAO treasuries, or even a way for crypto investment funds to store idle cash. The post Yield-Bearing Stablecoins Could Hit 50% Market Share: JPMorgan appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: BONK Hits $210M in Trading Volume‚ÄîBut Dragoin Is the Real Head-Turner
body: In 2025, meme coins are making a comeback, and this time they‚Äôre doing more than stirring nostalgia. After a quiet spell, the past week has brought renewed life to the market. Solana‚Äôs BONK posted double-digit gains with impressive volume, while Dragoin ($DDGN) captured growing interest with its interactive play-to-earn design. Investors are once again paying attention‚Äînot just to hype, but to tokens that offer real engagement and growth potential. BONK and Dragoin are showing they‚Äôre not just participating in the trend‚Äîthey‚Äôre shaping it. BONK Posts Big Gains & Surges in Trading Activity BONK, the top meme coin in the Solana ecosystem, has staged a significant comeback. On March 24, 2025, the token gained 14.8% within a single day, bringing its price to $0.00002507. But even more notable was its trading volume, which hit $210 million‚Äîone of the highest totals across the entire crypto market that day. This wasn‚Äôt just a random bump in interest. BONK‚Äôs performance came on the back of new exchange listings, growing developer involvement within Solana, and a fresh wave of social media activity. Analysts also highlight recent token burn announcements and community-led efforts as key drivers. As BONK bounces back from a challenging earlier stretch this year, many now see it as a core part of Solana‚Äôs push into DeFi and NFTs. Still, BONK‚Äôs rapid movement reflects how quickly meme coins can respond to sudden buzz. A listing or tweet can change everything‚Äîbut how long that energy lasts remains uncertain. That‚Äôs where Dragoin offers a more carefully structured alternative, built for durability. Dragoin Builds a Strong Foundation Around Utility & Engagement While BONK is making headlines, Dragoin ($DDGN) is steadily building a following. Unlike many meme coins that rely solely on hype, this Ethereum-based token is focusing on creating a lasting ecosystem. It combines entertainment with real incentives, setting it apart in a crowded field. At the center of Dragoin is a Telegram-based play-to-earn game. Players can hatch, train, and battle dragons, earning $DDGN tokens along the way. It‚Äôs not just for fun‚Äîit‚Äôs a system that turns participation into value. Users aren‚Äôt just buying and holding; they‚Äôre actively engaging, competing, and growing the network. Dragoin‚Äôs structure is another key to its appeal. It has a 200 billion token supply, with 50% allocated to a presale divided into 25 pricing stages. As each stage progresses, the price increases. Unsold tokens won‚Äôt linger‚Äîthey‚Äôll be permanently burned, increasing scarcity. The remaining tokens support liquidity, rewards, and development, with only 5% locked for the team under a two-year vesting schedule. That level of clarity and planning is still rare among meme projects. Dragoin‚Äôs next steps are already mapped out. In Q2 2025, it will roll out the full game, launch staking options, and expand with influencer collaborations. Q3 is set to bring listings on both centralized and decentralized exchanges, along with more in-game features. While the online buzz is growing fast, the plan behind it is focused on lasting growth‚Äînot quick spikes. Meme Coins Are Growing Up‚ÄîAnd So Are Their Audiences The strong rise of both BONK and Dragoin signals that meme coins are evolving‚Äîand so are the expectations of those investing in them. The market is no longer driven only by names or memes. It‚Äôs about utility, community, and what comes next. BONK, already established and widely recognized, is showing how a meme coin can adapt and align with a broader blockchain vision. Its recent trading activity and increased exchange visibility suggest that it‚Äôs becoming more than just a cultural relic‚Äîit‚Äôs taking on a strategic role in Solana‚Äôs crypto growth. Dragoin, on the other hand, represents a fresh direction. It‚Äôs not leaning on nostalgia. It‚Äôs offering a hands-on experience, paired with a token model that encourages long-term engagement. The combination of gaming, decentralization, and deflationary mechanics is striking a chord with a new wave of users who want to do more than just hold. Together, these two projects highlight different paths to success. BONK reflects resilience and evolution. Dragoin, meanwhile, offers innovation and a new kind of interaction. Both are thriving‚Äîbut each is writing its own unique story in the next chapter of meme coins. title: Unveiling Major Crypto Seizure: US DoJ Targets Hamas Terrorism Financing
body: In a significant move highlighting the ongoing battle against illicit finance in the digital age, the United States Department of Justice (DoJ) has announced the seizure of approximately $200,000 in cryptocurrency. This crypto seizure targeted a digital wallet allegedly linked to Hamas, the Palestinian militant group. The operation underscores the increasing scrutiny on cryptocurrency‚Äôs role in funding illegal activities and the proactive measures law enforcement agencies are taking to counter it. This incident also brings to the forefront critical questions about the use of digital assets in terrorism financing and the evolving regulatory landscape. What Exactly Happened with this Crypto Seizure? According to the DoJ, the seized cryptocurrency originated from a wallet believed to be controlled by Hamas. While the immediate seizure amounted to $200,000, authorities suspect this wallet was part of a larger network responsible for laundering around $1.5 million in funds for the organization. This operation is not isolated; it‚Äôs part of a broader effort by the U.S. government to disrupt and dismantle financial networks supporting terrorist groups. The details released by the DoJ indicate a sophisticated investigation that traced the flow of funds through the blockchain to identify and ultimately seize the assets. This successful crypto seizure is a testament to the growing capabilities of law enforcement in tracking and intercepting illicit cryptocurrency transactions. Why is Hamas Crypto Usage a Concern? The use of cryptocurrency by groups like Hamas raises several red flags. Here‚Äôs why this is a significant concern: Anonymity and Decentralization: Cryptocurrencies, by nature, offer a degree of anonymity and operate outside traditional financial systems. This decentralization can be exploited to evade detection and sanctions, making it challenging for authorities to track and control financial flows. Ease of Cross-Border Transactions: Cryptocurrency transactions are borderless, enabling groups to receive and transfer funds internationally without relying on traditional banking infrastructure. This ease of cross-border movement complicates efforts to monitor and intercept funds intended for illicit purposes, including terrorism financing. Lower Transaction Fees: Compared to traditional banking systems, cryptocurrency transactions often involve lower fees, making them an attractive option for frequent and large-scale money movements, even for activities like terrorism financing. Potential for Fundraising: Cryptocurrencies can be used to solicit donations globally through online platforms and social media. This fundraising mechanism can be particularly effective for groups seeking to operate outside the purview of traditional financial regulations. The recent crypto seizure highlights these vulnerabilities and underscores the urgent need for robust regulatory frameworks and international cooperation to combat the misuse of digital assets for illegal activities like terrorism financing. The Role of the DOJ in Combating Terrorism Financing The Department of Justice (DOJ) plays a crucial role in the U.S. government‚Äôs efforts to combat terrorism financing. Its responsibilities encompass a wide range of activities, including: Area Description Investigation and Prosecution The DoJ investigates and prosecutes individuals and entities involved in financing terrorism. This includes tracing financial flows, identifying facilitators, and bringing legal action against those who provide material support to terrorist organizations. Asset Forfeiture As demonstrated by this crypto seizure, the DoJ utilizes asset forfeiture laws to seize and confiscate assets derived from or used to facilitate terrorism financing. This disrupts the financial resources available to terrorist groups and prevents them from using these funds for further illicit activities. International Cooperation The DoJ works closely with international partners to share information, coordinate investigations, and extradite individuals involved in terrorism financing. This global collaboration is essential to address the transnational nature of terrorist financing networks. Policy and Strategy Development The DoJ contributes to the development of national policies and strategies to counter terrorism financing. This includes working with other government agencies and international bodies to enhance legal frameworks and improve enforcement mechanisms. The successful crypto seizure operation against Hamas is a clear example of the DOJ‚Äôs proactive approach and effectiveness in disrupting terrorist financing networks. How Does Crypto Laundering Work and How is it Being Addressed? Crypto laundering, the process of concealing the origin of cryptocurrency obtained illegally, is a growing concern for law enforcement agencies worldwide. The methods employed by criminals are becoming increasingly sophisticated, but so are the tools and techniques to counter them. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of how crypto laundering works and the measures being taken to address it: Common Crypto Laundering Techniques: Tumblers and Mixers: These services obscure the transaction history by mixing various cryptocurrency transactions together, making it harder to trace the original source of funds. Privacy Coins: Cryptocurrencies like Monero and Zcash offer enhanced privacy features, making transactions more difficult to trace compared to cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. Layered Transactions: Launderers may use multiple wallets and exchanges, moving funds through a complex web of transactions to obfuscate the money trail. Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs): DEXs often have less stringent KYC (Know Your Customer) requirements compared to centralized exchanges, providing avenues for laundering funds with reduced scrutiny. Cross-Chain Swaps: Converting cryptocurrencies across different blockchains can also be used to complicate tracing efforts. Addressing Crypto Laundering: Enhanced Regulations: Governments and regulatory bodies are implementing stricter regulations for cryptocurrency exchanges and service providers, including robust KYC and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) requirements. Blockchain Analytics Tools: Sophisticated blockchain analytics tools are being developed and utilized by law enforcement and financial institutions to trace cryptocurrency transactions, identify suspicious patterns, and uncover laundering schemes. International Collaboration: Global cooperation among law enforcement agencies and regulatory bodies is crucial for sharing information, coordinating investigations, and establishing international standards to combat crypto laundering. Public-Private Partnerships: Collaboration between government agencies and the cryptocurrency industry is essential to develop effective solutions and best practices for preventing and detecting crypto laundering. The seizure of funds from the Hamas wallet underscores the effectiveness of these countermeasures and the ongoing efforts to refine and improve them. The fight against crypto laundering is a continuous process that requires constant adaptation and innovation. What are the Broader Implications of this Hamas Crypto Case? This particular crypto seizure case has broader implications for the cryptocurrency world and beyond: Legitimacy of Crypto Under Scrutiny: Incidents like this, where cryptocurrency is linked to terrorism financing, can fuel skepticism about the legitimacy of digital assets and strengthen calls for stricter regulation. It is crucial for the crypto industry to proactively address these concerns and demonstrate its commitment to compliance and responsible use. Increased Regulatory Pressure: Expect to see increased regulatory pressure on the cryptocurrency industry globally. Governments will likely push for more stringent KYC/AML requirements, enhanced transaction monitoring, and greater oversight of crypto exchanges and service providers to prevent illicit activities. Advancements in Crypto Tracing Technology: The success of this crypto seizure will likely spur further investment and innovation in blockchain analytics and crypto tracing technologies. The ability to effectively track and intercept illicit cryptocurrency transactions is becoming increasingly vital for law enforcement and national security. Heightened Awareness of Terrorism Financing Risks: This case serves as a stark reminder of the evolving tactics used by terrorist organizations to finance their operations. It highlights the need for continuous vigilance and adaptation in strategies to counter terrorism financing, particularly in the digital realm. Actionable Insights: What Can Be Learned? For individuals and businesses involved in cryptocurrency, this event provides several actionable insights: Prioritize Security and Compliance: For cryptocurrency exchanges and service providers, robust security measures and strict adherence to KYC/AML regulations are paramount. Proactive compliance can help prevent the misuse of platforms for illicit activities and build trust with regulators and users. Stay Informed About Regulatory Developments: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrency is constantly evolving. Individuals and businesses need to stay informed about new regulations and adapt their practices accordingly to remain compliant. Support Responsible Crypto Use: The cryptocurrency community has a responsibility to promote the responsible use of digital assets and actively combat illicit activities. This includes supporting initiatives that enhance transparency, improve security, and foster collaboration with law enforcement. Understand the Risks: Users of cryptocurrency should be aware of the potential risks associated with illicit activities and take precautions to protect themselves from scams and involvement in illegal transactions. Conclusion: A Warning Shot for Illicit Crypto Use The U.S. DoJ‚Äôs crypto seizure from a Hamas-linked wallet is more than just a confiscation of funds; it‚Äôs a powerful statement. It demonstrates the resolve and increasing capability of law enforcement to track and disrupt illicit financial activities within the cryptocurrency ecosystem. This operation serves as a clear warning to those who seek to exploit digital assets for illegal purposes, including terrorism financing and crypto laundering. As cryptocurrency adoption grows, so too will the scrutiny and efforts to ensure its responsible and legitimate use. The future of cryptocurrency hinges on its ability to operate within a framework of transparency, security, and compliance, and this crypto seizure is a significant step in that direction. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption.

title: Unlock Bitcoin‚Äôs Hidden Potential: Plan B Reveals Why It‚Äôs Massively Undervalued Compared to Gold & Real Estate
body: In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, whispers of opportunity often echo louder than pronouncements. Recently, pseudonymous Bitcoin market analyst Plan B ignited a fresh wave of speculation by suggesting that Bitcoin is not just valuable, but profoundly undervalued when stacked against traditional titans like gold and real estate. For those navigating the crypto landscape, Plan B‚Äôs insights offer a compelling narrative, hinting at a potentially significant upside for Bitcoin enthusiasts. Let‚Äôs dive deep into this intriguing analysis and unpack what it means for the future of digital gold. Is Bitcoin Really Undervalued? Plan B Thinks So Plan B, a well-known figure in the crypto sphere for his stock-to-flow (S2F) model, took to X (formerly Twitter) to share his perspective on Bitcoin‚Äôs current market position. His core argument is simple yet powerful: Bitcoin‚Äôs market capitalization and scarcity metrics point towards a substantial undervaluation relative to gold and real estate. But what exactly does this mean, and how does he arrive at this conclusion? According to Plan B‚Äôs analysis, the numbers speak volumes: Bitcoin‚Äôs Market Cap: Currently hovering around $2 trillion. Gold‚Äôs Market Cap: A staggering $20 trillion. This ten-fold difference in market capitalization is the first red flag for Plan B. He argues that considering Bitcoin‚Äôs growing adoption, technological advancements, and its inherent scarcity, this valuation gap is simply too wide. But the comparison doesn‚Äôt stop at market cap. Plan B delves into another crucial metric: scarcity. Scarcity Showdown: Bitcoin vs. Gold Scarcity is a fundamental principle driving value in both traditional commodities like gold and digital assets like Bitcoin. Plan B highlights the concept of ‚Äústock-to-flow‚Äù ratio to illustrate this point. Stock-to-flow essentially measures the relationship between the existing supply of an asset (stock) and the rate at which new supply is produced (flow). A higher stock-to-flow ratio generally indicates greater scarcity and, theoretically, greater value retention over time. Let‚Äôs break down the stock-to-flow ratio for Bitcoin and gold as presented by Plan B: Bitcoin‚Äôs Stock-to-Flow Ratio: Approximately 120 years. Gold‚Äôs Stock-to-Flow Ratio: Around 60 years. Intriguingly, Bitcoin boasts a stock-to-flow ratio twice that of gold. This implies that Bitcoin is inherently scarcer than gold, at least based on this metric. Plan B posits that this superior scarcity should logically translate to a higher, or at least comparable, valuation. The fact that Bitcoin‚Äôs market cap is only a fraction of gold‚Äôs, despite its greater scarcity, further strengthens his argument for Bitcoin being undervalued . Real Estate Enters the Valuation Equation While gold is a traditional safe-haven asset often compared to Bitcoin, Plan B also brings real estate into the conversation. The global real estate market dwarfs both gold and Bitcoin in terms of total value. Estimates vary, but the global real estate market is often cited as being several times larger than the gold market, easily exceeding $200 trillion. Why include real estate in this comparison? Plan B‚Äôs rationale likely stems from the fact that real estate, like gold, is considered a store of value and a hedge against inflation. However, unlike Bitcoin, real estate is not inherently scarce and is significantly less divisible and portable. Bitcoin, on the other hand, offers digital scarcity, ease of transfer, and global accessibility. Considering the vastness of the real estate market, Bitcoin‚Äôs $2 trillion market cap appears even smaller in perspective. While real estate serves different purposes and has unique utility, the comparison highlights the immense potential upside if Bitcoin continues to gain traction as a global store of value. What Makes Bitcoin Potentially Undervalued? Beyond market cap and stock-to-flow, several factors contribute to the narrative of Bitcoin‚Äôs potential undervaluation: Growing Institutional Adoption: Major financial institutions, corporations, and even nation-states are increasingly recognizing Bitcoin as a legitimate asset class. This institutional influx brings significant capital and validation to the Bitcoin market. Limited Supply: Bitcoin‚Äôs capped supply of 21 million coins is a fundamental aspect of its value proposition. This hard cap ensures digital scarcity, contrasting sharply with fiat currencies that can be printed indefinitely. Decentralization and Security: Bitcoin‚Äôs decentralized nature and robust blockchain technology offer security and censorship resistance, appealing to individuals and entities seeking alternatives to traditional financial systems. Network Effects: As more people adopt and use Bitcoin, its network effect strengthens, further enhancing its value and utility. Technological Advancements: Ongoing developments like the Lightning Network and Taproot upgrades are improving Bitcoin‚Äôs scalability, privacy, and functionality. These factors collectively paint a picture of a maturing asset with strong fundamentals and growing adoption. If Plan B‚Äôs analysis is accurate, and Bitcoin is indeed undervalued , then the current price levels could represent a significant buying opportunity for long-term investors. Challenges and Counterarguments to Bitcoin‚Äôs Undervaluation While Plan B‚Äôs perspective is compelling, it‚Äôs crucial to acknowledge the counterarguments and challenges to the idea that Bitcoin is fundamentally undervalued: Volatility: Bitcoin remains a highly volatile asset. Price swings can be dramatic and unpredictable, deterring some investors and raising concerns about its stability as a store of value. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Unfavorable regulations in major economies could negatively impact Bitcoin‚Äôs price and adoption. Competition from Other Cryptocurrencies: The cryptocurrency market is constantly evolving, with new projects and technologies emerging. Bitcoin faces competition from other cryptocurrencies that may offer faster transaction speeds, lower fees, or different functionalities. Energy Consumption Concerns: Bitcoin‚Äôs proof-of-work consensus mechanism is energy-intensive, raising environmental concerns and attracting criticism. While solutions like the Lightning Network and layer-2 scaling aim to address this, it remains a valid concern for some. Market Sentiment and Speculation: Cryptocurrency markets are heavily influenced by market sentiment and speculation. Price movements can be driven by hype and fear, rather than solely by fundamental value. These challenges highlight the inherent risks associated with investing in Bitcoin and underscore the importance of conducting thorough research and understanding the complexities of the cryptocurrency market. Actionable Insights: Navigating the Undervalued Bitcoin Narrative So, what are the actionable takeaways from Plan B‚Äôs analysis and the broader discussion about Bitcoin‚Äôs potential undervaluation? Do Your Own Research (DYOR): Plan B‚Äôs analysis is a valuable perspective, but it‚Äôs crucial to conduct your own independent research. Understand Bitcoin‚Äôs technology, economics, and market dynamics. Consider Diversification: While Bitcoin may present a compelling investment opportunity, diversification is key to managing risk. Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. Consider allocating a portion of your portfolio to Bitcoin alongside other asset classes. Long-Term Perspective: Bitcoin is a long-term investment. Its volatility means short-term price fluctuations are inevitable. Focus on the long-term potential and avoid being swayed by short-term market noise. Stay Informed: The cryptocurrency space is rapidly evolving. Stay updated on market trends, regulatory developments, and technological advancements in the Bitcoin ecosystem. Risk Management: Only invest what you can afford to lose. Cryptocurrency investments carry inherent risks, and it‚Äôs essential to manage your risk appropriately. Conclusion: Bitcoin‚Äôs Undervalued Potential ‚Äì A Smart Investment? Plan B‚Äôs assertion that Bitcoin is undervalued compared to gold and real estate offers a thought-provoking perspective on the current cryptocurrency landscape. By highlighting the market cap disparity and superior stock-to-flow ratio, he presents a compelling case for Bitcoin‚Äôs untapped potential. While challenges and risks remain, the fundamental arguments for Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value proposition ‚Äì scarcity, decentralization, growing adoption ‚Äì are undeniable. Whether Bitcoin will ultimately reach the market capitalization levels of gold or real estate remains to be seen, but Plan B‚Äôs analysis certainly provides a strong incentive for investors to take a closer look and consider the smart investment opportunity that Bitcoin might represent. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: XRP Price Prediction: This $244,000,000 Trading Signal Kept XRP Below $3 in March 2025
body: XRP remained anchored around the $2.35 mark for most of Thursday, March 27. Over the past 30 days, traders have deployed nearly $400 million in short-leveraged positions, preventing XRP from breaking key resistance levels. How will XRP price react in April 2025? Ripple (XRP) Stagnates at $2.35 as Traders Remain Reluctant to Sell Ripple (XRP) has delivered notable gains over the past week, largely driven by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)‚Äôs decision to drop charges against Ripple. Many market participants expected a sharp correction following the 10% rally on Monday, assuming large investors would trigger a ‚Äúsell-the-news‚Äù event. However, sustained bullish sentiment, coupled with fresh volatility from Trump‚Äôs 25% auto tariff announcement, has helped XRP maintain stability. Ripple (XRP) Price Analysis | March 27 | Source: Coinmarketcap Market data from CoinMarketCap indicates that Ripple price briefly dipped to $2.30 before rebounding to $2.35 at press time. This intraday recovery suggests strong buying support at current levels. $244 Million XRP Short Leverage Cluster Emerges at $2.60 as Bears Look to Avert $3 Breakout While spot market sentiment has remained optimistic, XRP derivatives data signal stiff resistance clusters that could impede further price gains. Coinglass liquidation data highlights a notable discrepancy between short and long leverage positions. Over the past 30 days, bears have placed $404 million in short-leveraged positions‚Äî30% more than the $283 million in active long positions. The most significant concentration of these short positions, totalling $244 million, is clustered around the $2.60 level. Ripple (XRP) 30-day Liquidation Map, March 27 | Coinglass This high volume of short positions at $2.60 may explain why XRP has struggled to breach this resistance level, despite strong fundamental catalysts such as the SEC dropping its case against Ripple. Whenever XRP price approaches $2.60, an influx of sell orders from leveraged short positions forces a retracement, effectively capping bullish momentum. Until short positions are liquidated or bulls muster enough demand to absorb selling pressure, XRP may continue to face strong resistance at $2.60, delaying a potential breakout toward $3. XRP Price Forecast: Bulls Struggle as XRP Faces Key Resistance at $2.40, Eyes $2.00 Support XRP price remains under pressure, trading at $2.35, as it struggles to reclaim key resistance levels. The daily chart presents mixed signals, with the 50-day SMA at $2.52 acting as a key barrier to the upside, while support at $2.00 remains a critical level for bulls to defend. The declining MACD histogram suggests waning bullish momentum, as the MACD line flattens near the zero mark. This signals that buying pressure is fading, leaving room for potential downside movement. XRP Price Forecast The Parabolic SAR dots above the current price indicate a bearish trend, reinforcing the likelihood of further selling pressure. Additionally, declining volume confirms the lack of strong bullish conviction. However, if XRP reclaims $2.40 and closes above the 50-day SMA, it could spark renewed bullish momentum, targeting $2.60. Failure to hold above $2.30 could expose XRP to further declines, with bears eyeing the $2.00 psychological level as the next support. A decisive move below $2.00 would confirm a bearish breakdown, opening the door for further losses toward $1.76. The post XRP Price Prediction: This $244,000,000 Trading Signal Kept XRP Below $3 in March 2025 appeared first on CoinGape .

title: S&P 500, Interest Rates and Bitcoin: Analytics Firm Shares Three Scenarios for BTC Price in 2025
body: Cryptocurrency analytics firm Alphractal has published an in-depth assessment of Bitcoin (BTC) and broader market trends, shedding light on the relationship between interest rates, the S&P 500, and digital assets. The latest report, titled ‚ÄúInterest Rates, the S&P 500, and Bitcoin: Lessons from the Past and Expectations in 2025,‚Äù examines historical market reactions to the Fed‚Äôs policy changes and offers important insights for investors navigating the current economic environment. Dot-Com Bubble (2000-2002): Fed rate hikes contributed to the bursting of the tech bubble, causing the S&P 500 to fall by nearly 50% as overvalued companies collapsed. Subprime Crisis (2007-2009): The S&P 500 fell nearly 57% as the Fed raised interest rates to combat inflation and excessive credit, triggering a global financial crisis. COVID-19 Crash and Recovery (2020): The Fed‚Äôs emergency rate cuts and liquidity injections initially led to a sharp 35% decline in the S&P 500, followed by a rapid recovery. Bitcoin has been volatile, but has ultimately benefited from the low-interest environment, strengthening its appeal as an alternative asset. Current Cycle (2022-2025): Divergence in Market Behavior Since 2022, the Fed has aggressively raised interest rates from near-zero to 5.5% to counter post-pandemic inflation. Unlike previous crises, the S&P 500 has remained resilient, reaching new highs in 2024-2025. Alphractal attributes this to the following reasons: Lower corporate leverage compared to 2008. Strong performance from AI and technology giants like NVIDIA and Microsoft. Expectations of gradual interest rate cuts are fueling investor optimism. However, the divergence between interest rates and stock market performance is a major concern, according to the analyst firm. Historically, such a breakout has been preceded by high volatility. Bitcoin's historical performance reveals a strong correlation with liquidity conditions: 2010-2021 (Low Interest Rate Era): Bitcoin rose from mere cents to $69,000 in 2021. 2022 Rate Hikes: BTC experienced a sharp correction and dropped to around $16,000. 2024-2025 Stabilization: Bitcoin has regained strength as interest rates have fallen slightly, consolidating its role as a hedge against expansionary monetary policy and inflation. What Happens to Bitcoin If the Fed Cuts Interest Rates? According to Alphractal, the impact of future rate cuts will depend on their nature: Emergency Cuts (Symptom of Crisis): If the Fed is forced to cut rates due to a major economic shock (similar to 2008 or 2020), initial market reactions may be bearish, with both the S&P 500 and Bitcoin experiencing sharp declines. Preemptive Cuts (Soft Landing): Gradual interest rate cuts, as seen in 1995-1996 and 2019, can support market growth, benefiting both stocks and digital assets. Market Scenarios 2025: Alphractal's Forecasts Alphractal outlines three possible scenarios for 2025: Gradual Rate Cuts: If the Fed cuts interest rates in a controlled manner without triggering a recession, the S&P 500 could maintain its upward momentum and Bitcoin could benefit from increased liquidity. External Shock: A new crisis such as geopolitical instability, banking collapse or another pandemic could cause a sharp decline in the market despite interest rate cuts. Persistently High Interest Rates: If inflation remains stubborn and the Fed maintains or raises interest rates, a severe market correction similar to 2000 or 2008 could ensue. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: S&P 500, Interest Rates and Bitcoin: Analytics Firm Shares Three Scenarios for BTC Price in 2025

title: US economy expands 2.4% in Q4 as corporate profits surge 5.9%
body: The United States economy experienced significant growth of 2.4% in the final quarter of 2024. This growth exceeded expectations and expert predictions. Corporate after-tax earnings rose by 5.9% during the fourth quarter of 2024, the largest quarterly growth‚ÄÇsince 2021. Firms were making more revenue and higher‚ÄÇmargins, with non-financial corporate profits at 15.9% of gross value added. The fourth-quarter GDP numbers ‚Äúdemonstrate that the economy is heading into this year with great momentum and profitability and is resilient to some level of‚ÄÇpolicy uncertainty,‚Äù Wells Fargo economists Shannon Grein and Tim Quinlan said. But they fretted over how businesses‚ÄÇwould respond if trade conditions changed and uncertainty over where the economy is headed. That level of profitability is far above historical averages, which suggests that companies may be able to swallow‚ÄÇpersistent cost increases rather than pass them on to consumers. That‚ÄÇcould help keep inflation under control even as trade policies change. Consumer spending slows as businesses stock up Consumer spending, which accounts for nearly two-thirds of the economy, increased at a revised 4% pace in the fourth‚ÄÇquarter, a bit below prior estimates. And businesses raced‚ÄÇto import goods ahead of anticipated tariffs, which helped fuel a jump in imports. The trade gap stayed elevated in February but shrank slightly from a record in January. Some economists caution that this surge of imports will lead to a‚ÄÇslowdown in GDP growth in early 2025. Another key economic measure, gross domestic income (GDI), rose 4.5% in the fourth quarter from 1.4% in the‚ÄÇthird quarter. While GDP measures how much people and businesses spend on goods and services, GDI measures the‚ÄÇincome earned and the costs involved in producing them. Those two‚ÄÇmeasures grew 3.5% on average last quarter, the fastest pace in a year. A report on Thursday showed that new unemployment claims held steady at 224,000 last week,‚ÄÇmeaning that the number of people applying for jobless benefits changed a bit. Uncertain trade policies shape 2025 economic outlook Economic growth was robust in the‚ÄÇfourth quarter of 2024 but is expected to slow in the months ahead. Most economists are cautious about the future, pointing to shifting trade policies‚ÄÇand business uncertainty. Even two of the most powerful investment banks in the world, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, have already cut back their forecasts, citing the uncertain global trade environment as a potential drag on economic‚ÄÇgrowth. In an age of surging tariffs, new trade deals, and the potential creation of‚ÄÇadditional policies, businesses are increasingly reluctant to invest and expand as they work through the unclear swamps of an uncertain market environment. These concerns have led to an update of the‚ÄÇFederal Reserve ºs economic outlook and a recognition of the risks to growth. Some economists now expect G.D.P. to reduce in the first‚ÄÇthree months of 2025 as businesses and consumers dial back spending in the face of an uncertain economic outlook. A rise in imports in the early months of the year, partly propelled by companies stockpiling goods ahead of new tariffs, could also‚ÄÇdepress growth. If companies cut back on production or‚ÄÇlower spending because of higher costs, that could slash more water on economic activity. title: Solana-Based Zebec Network Launches Crypto Debit Card with Mastercard
body: Key Takeaways: A new card connects crypto payments with daily commerce, easing the shift between digital funds and traditional money. Built on a Solana-based protocol, it simplifies activation and everyday use. The model bypasses standard ID checks to protect user data. It joins a growing trend of merging digital finance with conventional payment methods. Zebec Network, a payments protocol based on Solana, rolled out its crypto debit card, Zebec Carbon , on March 27 through a collaboration with Mastercard . The new offering seeks to connect cryptocurrencies and traditional finance by enabling seamless spending of digital assets anywhere Mastercard is accepted. Introducing Zebec Carbon ‚Äì The world‚Äôs first reloadable, zero-fee and fully private crypto debit card. Reloadable for up to $10K of daily spend Ready in seconds Zero fees ‚Äì 1 USDC = $1 USD 100% Private Powered globally by Mastercard pic.twitter.com/aErc2aqQ2K ‚Äî Zebec Network (@Zebec_HQ) March 27, 2025 Its features include instant activation, zero fees, complete privacy, and compatibility with Apple Pay and Google Pay. Unlike traditional bank-linked debit cards, Zebec Carbon is funded with stablecoins such as USDC , which are converted into fiat at a 1:1 ratio at the time of payment. The card has a limit of $1,000 per transaction and a maximum daily spending cap of $10,000. The product is also touted for its privacy-first approach, ensuring that users‚Äô spending activity remains undisclosed. For U.S. residents, there‚Äôs no ID verification required‚Äîapproval is instant, which lowers the barrier for getting started. With this launch, Zebec joins the growing movement of crypto platforms integrating digital assets into everyday transactions. However, it is not the first player in the market to introduce such a product. Several major crypto firms, including MetaMask and Floki, have launched similar debit cards in recent months. MetaMask and the Evolution of Crypto Debit Card MetaMask, best known for its self-custodial crypto wallet, began testing its crypto debit card in the U.S. back in December 2024. The card works both online and in stores, converting crypto to fiat right at checkout. MetaMask Crypto Card lets US users to make everyday purchases with crypto anywhere Mastercard is accepted. #MetaMask #CryptoCard #CryptoDebitCard https://t.co/dTZLlFbEht ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) December 19, 2024 The MetaMask Card is already available in several countries, including the EU, the UK, Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia, and there are plans for further expansion. Users can also link their digital wallets to Apple Pay or Google Pay, making it easier to incorporate crypto payments into everyday spending habits. The card runs on the Linea network and supports USDC , USDT , and WETH . Floki and Avalanche Join the Debit Card Race Floki entered the debit card game around the same time, offering users a way to spend a wide range of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, USDC, and its native Floki token across various blockchains. @RealFlokiInu Debit Card launches with options for virtual and physical cards, allowing users to spend crypto at Visa and Mastercard merchants. #floki #crypto https://t.co/2wbgipqVkf ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) December 9, 2024 The card is available in both digital and physical versions. The virtual card costs 10 euros, while the physical one goes for 32 euros plus shipping. There‚Äôs a 2% fee when topping up, but no charges for transactions or currency exchange. Floki also introduced global-use virtual gift cards for added flexibility. Meanwhile, Avalanche released its own crypto debit card under Visa. It first became available in Latin America and the Caribbean and includes features like custom PINs, spending alerts, and self-custody controls. The Future of Crypto Payments with Mastercard In addition to these individual crypto card launches, Mastercard itself has also been making moves in the blockchain space. The company recently integrated its Multi-Token Network (MTN) with J.P. Morgan‚Äôs Kinexys Digital Payments platform to facilitate cross-border blockchain transactions. @Mastercard partners with @jpmorgan to enhance cross-border payments via blockchain integration.
